content.question: A student measures the absorbance of a solution containing <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions using a spectrophotometer. The cuvette used by the student has two frosted walls and two transparent walls. The student properly orients the cuvette so that the path of the light goes through the transparent sides of the cuvette when calibrating the spectrophotometer. How will the measured absorbance of the <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> be affected if the student incorrectly orients the cuvette so that the path of the light is through the frosted sides of the cuvette?

choices.label: The measured absorbance of the <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> solution will not be affected.

The measured absorbance of the <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> solution will be higher than the actual absorbance.

The measured absorbance of the <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> solution will be lower than the actual absorbance.

The effect on the measured absorbance of the <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> solution depends on the concentration of the <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> solution.

content.answer: The measured absorbance of the <math alttext="F e S C N with a positive 2 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>FeSCN</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> solution will be higher than the actual absorbance.

skill.text: 2.E: Identify or describe potential sources of experimental error.
